items.title: Turn on FaceTime
items.text: If you're using an iPhone, FaceTime automatically registers your phone number. To also register your email address on your iPhone, go to Settings > FaceTime > Use your Apple ID for FaceTime, and sign in with your Apple ID.

items.title: Make a FaceTime call
items.text: To make a FaceTime call, you need the persons phone number or registered email address. There are a few ways to make a FaceTime call. In the FaceTime app,tap the plus button and type the persons phone number or email address.Tap the number or address, then tap Audio or Video.

items.title: Use FaceTime Audio with Call Waiting
items.text: When another call comes in — either a phone call or another FaceTime audio call — you can choose one of these options: End the current call and accept the incoming call. -Accept the incoming call and put the current call on hold. -Decline the incoming call.

items.title: Use your Memoji in FaceTime
items.text: On an iPhone X or later, or an iPad with Face ID, you can create a Memoji to match your personality and mood, then use the Memoji during a FaceTime video call.

items.title: Use FaceTime Live Photos
items.text: With iOS 12.1.4 and later, and iPadOS, you can capture moments with your friends and family using Live Photos during a FaceTime video call.
